text: To view a list of all claims with the status of "Ready for submission" or "Submitted bill", go to the Claims Submission page. To find which batch a particular claim is in, go to the Claim page and click the "Audit trail" tab. You will see an entry under the Details column that says "Submitted to clearinghouse batch #XXXXXX, file XXXXXXX".

text.text: Can you provide an overview of the process for sending collection letters in ZOLL Billing?

text: ZOLL Billing does not send collections letters. To monitor patients that received a collections letter, move the account to the "Collections letter sent" tab the day the letter goes out. This tab will show you the account, number of claims, last statement date, the day you sent the collection letter, and account balance.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing differentiate between final statements and collection letters?

text: The account must be in a "Collection letter sent" or "Final statement sent" status. To move an account to collections, click either the Final statement sent or Collection letter sent tab.

text.text: Are collection letters automatically generated or does the user need to manually trigger them?

text: To move an account to collections, click either the Final statement sent or Collection letter sent tab. The user needs to manually trigger them.

text.text: What information is included in a collection letter sent through ZOLL Billing?

text: The collection letter tab will show you the account, number of claims, last statement date, the day you sent the collection letter, and account balance.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle responses or actions taken by patients after receiving a collection letter?

text: ZOLL Billing will not generate patient invoices on future claims associated with this account. However, if the patient has insurance, the claim will still be sent to the insurance provider.

text.text: Is there a limit to the number of collection letters that can be sent to a patient or account in ZOLL Billing?

text: There is no limit to the number of collection letters that can be sent to a patient or account in ZOLL Billing.

text.text: What are some best practices for optimizing the effectiveness of collection letters sent through ZOLL Billing?

text: To monitor patients that received a collections letter, move the account to the Collections letter sent tab the day the letter goes out.

text.text: how to move the account to 'Collections letter sent'

text: To move an account to the "Collections letter sent" tab, you can: 1. Hover over Claims on the navigation bar and select Patient Billing 2. Depending on the account's status, click either the Final statement sent or Collection letter sent tab 3. Scroll down to find the account or enter the patient name in the box under the column heading 4. On that same line, click the review icon 5. Click the Edit suspension button 6. On the "Suspend patient billing" window, click Collections letter sent and then Suspend.
